sentences.en: a map showing the disposition of American forces
He had at his disposition large sums of money.
sentences.cn: 他可以支配大量的金钱.

sentences.en: He is considering the disposition of furniture in his new house.
sentences.cn: 他在考虑怎样在新居中布置家具.

sentences.en: He was a nice lad — bright and with a sunny disposition.
sentences.cn: 他是个不错的小伙子——聪明伶俐而且性格开朗。

sentences.en: Neither side shows the slightest disposition to compromise.
sentences.cn: 双方都没有表露出丝毫妥协的意思。

sentences.en: She has shown no abnormality in intelligence or in disposition.
sentences.cn: 她在智力或性情上都未显示出任何反常.

sentences.en: the disposition of assets on death
The rides are unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition.
sentences.cn: 这种骑乘不适合紧张型性格的人。

sentences.en: The twin brothers are alike in appearance but differ greatly in disposition.
sentences.cn: 这对孪生兄弟外貌很相像,但性格却相差很大.

sentences.en: The two men are unlike in disposition.
The waiter has a sunny disposition.
They show no disposition to improvise or to take risks.
sentences.cn: 他们不愿意临时凑合或冒险。

sentences.en: This has given him a disposition to consider our traditions critically.
sentences.cn: 这使他倾向以批判眼光看待我们的传统。

words.tran_cn: 可任意处理的；可自由使用的；用完即可丢弃的
有…倾向的；打算做…的；有某种健康状态的
处理；配置；使适应（dispose的过去分词）；使有倾向

trans.tran_cn: 性格，倾向，排列，布置，（财产）赠予，分配
trans.tran_en: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way
